story:
Why am I doing this?
 

In the past 8 years I have helped thousands of people improve their lives, helping them manage their money better (as a financial advisor) and improve their lives and companies (since 2014, as an executive and personal coach). My book is a crucial tool in this process (it proves to everyone that you can overcome all obstacles, no matter what), helping me to “open” the minds of teenagers and adults to new possibilities and ideas... it is the starting point of my work as a coach and trainer.

So far I’ve done this work in Portugal, but I believe it’s time to spread my wings and help people from other countries, all around the world. The “international version” of the book, in English, is the starting point for this process, and consequently...  YOU ARE THE STARTING POINT FOR THIS PROCESS!!!

 

Why would you contribute?

There are 4 main reasons to help us on this campaign:

1. Do you like reading? Do you like travel books?
You are in the right place... this is a fantastic book about a self-discovery trip! (discover more below);

2. Do you love a good story? A good adventure?
You are in the right place... this is a fantastic adventure, the story of a crazy trip I made with almost nothing! (discover more below);

3. Do you love to help others to grow, to improve their lives?
Again, you’re in the right place... You’re helping me to improve the lives of thousands of people, through the book itself and all the work I do around it, as a coach;

4. Do you love to help others through social work?
If this is you, you’re also in the right place... We already donate 10% of the Portuguese edition’s profits to Mundos de Vida Association (a foster family program for kids at risk, in Portugal), and we’ll do the same with the international version, including also the Kimberly Moore Foundation (more information below).

 

What’s the book about, after all?
 

Picture yourself landing in Skellefteå (north of Sweden) in February, winter, no phone or computer, no money or credit card, only a backpack with a few things in it (clothes, sleeping bag, powder milk for 2 days) and your ability to solve problems. Picture yourself with snow up to your height, in some areas, freezing temperatures around -25ºC (-13ºF), knowing nothing about the country, knowing almost no one there... and now, you “just” need to return home. This is the Bare Nomad story, the trip I made in 13 days, from Sweden to Portugal.

 

 

How can you participate?

You can help me with three simple steps:
 

1. Choose your perk!
I’m offering from a sincere “thank you! note” to a 7 days trip with me, in Portugal; from the simplest version of the book, to the “exclusive hardcover limited edition” one; from including your name in the book to a personal coaching session with me; from a 15% discount to a larger one of 40%... you just need to choose how big and fantastic your reward will be!!!

2. Contribute!
Take action immediately: click “get this perk” and fulfill your contribution, using the payment option you prefer.

3. Share with your friends and colleagues!
Use your social networks, mailing list, personal contacts, and spread the word: the more people you “inflame”, the more I’ll be able to do and the bigger will be the impact of the project. And if you have good media connections, help me talk to them.

 

 

How will I use this money?

The campaign funds will be used in 5 big areas:

 

 

Who’s involved?

Me, Ricardo Frade, for a start!

And I have to say that I have some experience on this:

1. I started this project in 2012, with the original crowdfunding campaign on a portuguese platform (Massivemov.com), raising almost 6.000€ (around $7,400) all by myself, in only 30 days;

2. I published the book without a publisher, only me and Paula Lobo, my “homemade” editor. We’ve almost done a “PhD” in self-publishing using Google, Youtube and a lot of trial and error… We know everything about self-publishing, so we can do it all over again!

3. I have sold more than 6,000 copies all by myself, without a publisher (I know, it’s not a lot for the US market, but in my tiny country it’s a lot), in 3 years, in more than 200 presentations (in libraries, coffee shops, churches, bars, seminars, universities and schools, business associations and other places) and other strange contexts (travelling, on the beach, in fairs and local markets, train and bus stations, etc).  


This time, however, I have help, for the translation, the editing and the campaign itself;

  • Sofia, my wife and the woman behind all the paperwork of our company;
  • Amélia, my public-relations, the girl behind 2 years of book's presentations;
  • Vasco, the web-design-cinema guy, responsible for all web development and multimedia work of our company;

 

  • Pedro and Simone, the crazy movie/communication guys from Bright Creations, who work with us in all projects;

 

  • Bruno, Jacinta, Vítor, Marta and Nuno, and also Márcia and André, the guys from Detalhe-SP, the graphic design company that’s creating the cover for the book with us;

 

  • Tânia Castilho, aka T. C. Aeelah, the fantastic lady teacher from Linda’s School who had the courage (and craziness!) to start the partnership with me for the Translation Collaborative and Education Project with Linda’s School’s students... and the teachers and students from Linda’s School, who accepted this HUGE challenge;

 

  • A LOT of FANTASTIC people who believe in this project and are helping us in different ways, like the following:

 

AND YOU!!!

All together, we’ll succeed, delivering this book worldwide and helping thousands of people in the way!

 

The 3 step translation project, with Linda’s School

This book is a tool for changing lives, as I said earlier. This includes the lives of those who worked on the translation, teenage students and teachers at Linda’s School (a fantastic language school in Tomar, Portugal): for them this was a MAJOR stretch, and they became better people with this 3 step process, as they’ll explain personally in the video.

 

The first step was to read the book and translate it in small groups, a collaborative task that helped them to grow as team members, to get used to having feedback (good or not) and to get the job done, no matter how hard it is. The second step will be the effort to make this campaign a huge success, which means to learn how to communicate an idea to people and how to help them enrol in the project… basically, how to sell (it’s an entrepreneurial step, and it will be useful for the rest of their lives).

The third step will be to use the money they will get with the translation to impact the lives of other teenagers and kids. It will be a social learning step for them, since they decided, along with the school and teachers, to use the translation amount not as a way to get money for them or the school, but as a way to help others in need. This means that they will receive this money as “payment” for the work they’ve done, but they will donate it all to the two foundations included in the project (Mundos de Vida and Kimberly Moore Foundation).

 

The social part of the project

My mentors taught me that we should give back, always, in each and every project we’re in, so this is not an exception. We’re giving to Mundos de Vida Association 10% of the profits on the Portuguese version of the book, and we’ll do the same with the international version. This time, however, we’ll include an international cause too, the Kimberly Moore Foundation, responsible for the smiles of thousands of kids in the USA and other countries around the world, with their program Adopt-a-letter and Adopt-a-country. Discover more in here and here

Mundos de Vida (Portugal)

 

Kimberly Moore Foundation (USA)

 

What if we overachieve the campaign goal?

If/when we overachieve the campaign’s financial goal, there area a few stretch goals to put in place: present the book in other countries, participate in book fairs in these countries (Canada, Sweden and Malaysia/Singapore are a few ideas) This is the first one, but there are others to be shared, step by step.

 

Why Indiegogo?

It’s the most flexible, easy and accessible world-class leading platform for launching crowdfunding ideas and projects… that’s it! Thank you guys for providing us with this fantastic tool!

How science works...

Every year roughly 2.5 million scientific articles are published by an estimated 7.8 million researchers1.  Now think back to 2017... How many scientific publications did you read? And how often did you read about scientific breakthroughs in popular media? Truth be told, unless you are an active researcher that needs to stay abreast of the latest developments in your field, scientific publications are boring.  Heck, even scientists find most articles boring.  They'll never admit to it, but it is true. Yet this is how science works.  You do sciency things, write it as short as possible without losing too much detail and then rewrite the article a couple of times to please a handful of your peers.  When everybody is happy, you pay the journal a large sum of money to publish the article for you, and then you start hoping that someone else cites your work in theirs. 

There exists a need for scientists to communicate...

Scientists are the investigators of truth in our world, however, few actually get the chance to communicate their results outside of the scientific realm.  We want to change that, by giving scientists a platform to disseminate their results directly to the general public.  After publication in an accredited journal, the scientist then rewrites their article for our audience.  Using our search algorithms, anyone can find articles on their subject of interest, written in easy to understand English, with links to the original scholarly articles.  We encourage the use of analogies to explain complex concepts.  Take the Higgs boson, also known as the god-particle.  The discovery made major headlines, and people were up in arms about its discovery.  But could you explain what the Higgs boson means in our everyday life?   We ran a story on the possible discovery of a anti-matter counterpart of the Higgs boson predicted by a group of South African researchers, and explained the Higgs boson as follow:

"Various analogies exist to explain the Higgs boson, however, we would like to compare it to a body of water, such as a dam or lake, which is filled with drops of water. Each waterdrop can be seen as a Higgs-boson, which together forms a Higgs-field, or in our case a lake. On this lake, various water-sports are practised. Birds are flying over the dam, while a couple are gliding in a canoe. A man is busy swimming, and a woman is running into the water. Each individual explains how different particles interact with the Higgs-field. Photons, the particles that make up light, does not interact with the field at all, and as the birds, they just pass by. The canoe gliding smootly on the water encounters very little resistance from the water, just as electrons do in the Higgs-field. The man swimming encounters more resistance and needs more energy than the gliding canoe, just as the quarks that make up protons and neutrons. The woman running in the water encounters the most resistance, as does W and Z bosons. In this case, the “resistance” encountered equals the mass of the particle, the more “resistance” the more mass the particle has."

Even the most complex theories can be explained as easy to understand analogies.  Furthermore, by understanding the latest scientific discoveries, as reported by the scientist themselves, our society can start to question anything and everything, and find answers for themselves. This, in turn, will result in increased numbers of citizen scientists, knowledgeable and up to date with scientific facts.  Plus, just think how awesome it would be to say "I've recently read a scientific, peer-reviewed paper about that" the next time you meet a climate change denialist-, anti-vax-, flat-earther avocado-junkie. 

Our thirst for knowledge is what makes us human.  Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson is arguably one of the most famous living scientists, and although he's a regular on lots of TV shows and news bulletins, he is also a prolific academic writer.  He sums up the importance of our search for truth in this video:

 

But what is in it for the scientist?

Scientists have a lot on their to-do lists.  They need to apply for research funding, develop methods, publish their findings, develop and train other scientists and try to have a normal social life as well.  Being scientists ourselves (two of our team are currently completing PhDs), we understand the burden placed upon researchers, be it in academia or in the private sector. That is why we developed a business model which would make most business analysts (including our Financial Officer) cringe.  Based on the number of times an article is read or shared on Facebook and Twitter, we will distribute 60% of all advertising revenue generated back to researchers.   As our financial position gets better, we'll increase this up to the point where all income generated by adds are paid back to the scientists. We created this business model to give back to the scientific community for all the hard work done.  These funds will be made available to scientists as vouchers for the open access publishing of their future research.  By paying for open access publishing, we will be creating a society where science is open, responsible and to the benefit of everyone.

How would my contribution be used?

QuoteMyLab.com started like most success stories as an idea on a napkin back in 2015.  From there it was developed and tested in the South African market.  We learned a lot during our 2017 trial period, including that scientists really appreciate incentives for their work.  We are busy revamping the website for an international audience and aim to have a live beta-version in April 2018.  We have not taken on any investments for QuoteMyLab.com, as we want to remain open-access, and feel that the money should go to people in lab coats rather than designer suits.  We also need some legal advice to ensure that all copyright requirements are met. 

Being a bootstrapped company, we need to find some form of runway money.  And by bootstrapped, I truly mean bootstrapped.  We've exploited every single family member, maxed out credit facilities, and even quit jobs to bring this project to life. If we are to meet the April deadline, we would spend the capital raised by this campaign as follow:

 

Once the website is launched, we'll be using donations to keep it online, similar to how Wikipedia operates.  All articles will be under a creative commons licences, meaning that it could be used freely, as long as the original author and QuoteMyLab.com are cited.  As mentioned above, 60 % of all income generated by advertisements will be redistributed to researchers publishing on our platform.  As we reach financial stability, this redistribution percentage will be increased, to the point where 100% of all revenue generated by adds are paid back to researchers.  We are a social enterprise, and will always be focused on disseminating scientific publications and giving back to the scientific community.

What will be delivered if we meet our target of $15000?

We are excited to release the Beta version of our site as soon as possible, however, to ensure that there are no major bugs, we are testing the current platform to it's widest extent.  The main deliverable will be the website, quotemylab.com, which will be preloaded with several articles.  Users will be able to upload their articles, after which our team will ensure that the articles meet our high standards.  The first articles will receive an automatic payment of $50 to the researcher.  These articles will assist us in search engine optimisation.  The website will have a discussion panel beneath every article, where members can discuss the paper and ask questions where something is unclear.

Other Ways You Can Help

Launching a campaign in January might not be the smartest thing we've done.  You might have a major credit card bill from spending a little too much on loved ones over the festive season.  But we would really appreciate your assistance in any (but preferably all) of the following ways:

  • Sharing this campaign on social media, tagging as many scientists as possible (we know they aren't socially active, but  try anyway).
  • Registering for our newsletter on our website:  QuoteMyLab.com 
  • Reading a scientific article about a question you might have.

For any questions, suggestions, comments please contact us at indiegogo@quotemylab.com
story_txt:
How science works...
Every year roughly 2.5 million scientific articles are published by an estimated 7.8 million researchers1.  Now think back to 2017... How many scientific publications did you read? And how often did you read about scientific breakthroughs in popular media? Truth be told, unless you are an active researcher that needs to stay abreast of the latest developments in your field, scientific publications are boring.  Heck, even scientists find most articles boring.  They'll never admit to it, but it is true. Yet this is how science works.  You do sciency things, write it as short as possible without losing too much detail and then rewrite the article a couple of times to please a handful of your peers.  When everybody is happy, you pay the journal a large sum of money to publish the article for you, and then you start hoping that someone else cites your work in theirs. 

There exists a need for scientists to communicate...
Scientists are the investigators of truth in our world, however, few actually get the chance to communicate their results outside of the scientific realm.  We want to change that, by giving scientists a platform to disseminate their results directly to the general public.  After publication in an accredited journal, the scientist then rewrites their article for our audience.  Using our search algorithms, anyone can find articles on their subject of interest, written in easy to understand English, with links to the original scholarly articles.  We encourage the use of analogies to explain complex concepts.  Take the Higgs boson, also known as the god-particle.  The discovery made major headlines, and people were up in arms about its discovery.  But could you explain what the Higgs boson means in our everyday life?   We ran a story on the possible discovery of a anti-matter counterpart of the Higgs boson predicted by a group of South African researchers, and explained the Higgs boson as follow:
"Various analogies exist to explain the Higgs boson, however, we would like to compare it to a body of water, such as a dam or lake, which is filled with drops of water. Each waterdrop can be seen as a Higgs-boson, which together forms a Higgs-field, or in our case a lake. On this lake, various water-sports are practised. Birds are flying over the dam, while a couple are gliding in a canoe. A man is busy swimming, and a woman is running into the water. Each individual explains how different particles interact with the Higgs-field. Photons, the particles that make up light, does not interact with the field at all, and as the birds, they just pass by. The canoe gliding smootly on the water encounters very little resistance from the water, just as electrons do in the Higgs-field. The man swimming encounters more resistance and needs more energy than the gliding canoe, just as the quarks that make up protons and neutrons. The woman running in the water encounters the most resistance, as does W and Z bosons. In this case, the “resistance” encountered equals the mass of the particle, the more “resistance” the more mass the particle has."
Even the most complex theories can be explained as easy to understand analogies.  Furthermore, by understanding the latest scientific discoveries, as reported by the scientist themselves, our society can start to question anything and everything, and find answers for themselves. This, in turn, will result in increased numbers of citizen scientists, knowledgeable and up to date with scientific facts.  Plus, just think how awesome it would be to say "I've recently read a scientific, peer-reviewed paper about that" the next time you meet a climate change denialist-, anti-vax-, flat-earther avocado-junkie. 
Our thirst for knowledge is what makes us human.  Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson is arguably one of the most famous living scientists, and although he's a regular on lots of TV shows and news bulletins, he is also a prolific academic writer.  He sums up the importance of our search for truth in this video:
 
But what is in it for the scientist?
Scientists have a lot on their to-do lists.  They need to apply for research funding, develop methods, publish their findings, develop and train other scientists and try to have a normal social life as well.  Being scientists ourselves (two of our team are currently completing PhDs), we understand the burden placed upon researchers, be it in academia or in the private sector. That is why we developed a business model which would make most business analysts (including our Financial Officer) cringe.  Based on the number of times an article is read or shared on Facebook and Twitter, we will distribute 60% of all advertising revenue generated back to researchers.   As our financial position gets better, we'll increase this up to the point where all income generated by adds are paid back to the scientists. We created this business model to give back to the scientific community for all the hard work done.  These funds will be made available to scientists as vouchers for the open access publishing of their future research.  By paying for open access publishing, we will be creating a society where science is open, responsible and to the benefit of everyone.

How would my contribution be used?
QuoteMyLab.com started like most success stories as an idea on a napkin back in 2015.  From there it was developed and tested in the South African market.  We learned a lot during our 2017 trial period, including that scientists really appreciate incentives for their work.  We are busy revamping the website for an international audience and aim to have a live beta-version in April 2018.  We have not taken on any investments for QuoteMyLab.com, as we want to remain open-access, and feel that the money should go to people in lab coats rather than designer suits.  We also need some legal advice to ensure that all copyright requirements are met. 
Being a bootstrapped company, we need to find some form of runway money.  And by bootstrapped, I truly mean bootstrapped.  We've exploited every single family member, maxed out credit facilities, and even quit jobs to bring this project to life. If we are to meet the April deadline, we would spend the capital raised by this campaign as follow:

 
Once the website is launched, we'll be using donations to keep it online, similar to how Wikipedia operates.  All articles will be under a creative commons licences, meaning that it could be used freely, as long as the original author and QuoteMyLab.com are cited.  As mentioned above, 60 % of all income generated by advertisements will be redistributed to researchers publishing on our platform.  As we reach financial stability, this redistribution percentage will be increased, to the point where 100% of all revenue generated by adds are paid back to researchers.  We are a social enterprise, and will always be focused on disseminating scientific publications and giving back to the scientific community.

What will be delivered if we meet our target of $15000?
We are excited to release the Beta version of our site as soon as possible, however, to ensure that there are no major bugs, we are testing the current platform to it's widest extent.  The main deliverable will be the website, quotemylab.com, which will be preloaded with several articles.  Users will be able to upload their articles, after which our team will ensure that the articles meet our high standards.  The first articles will receive an automatic payment of $50 to the researcher.  These articles will assist us in search engine optimisation.  The website will have a discussion panel beneath every article, where members can discuss the paper and ask questions where something is unclear.

Other Ways You Can Help
Launching a campaign in January might not be the smartest thing we've done.  You might have a major credit card bill from spending a little too much on loved ones over the festive season.  But we would really appreciate your assistance in any (but preferably all) of the following ways:

Sharing this campaign on social media, tagging as many scientists as possible (we know they aren't socially active, but  try anyway).
Registering for our newsletter on our website:  QuoteMyLab.com 
Reading a scientific article about a question you might have.

For any questions, suggestions, comments please contact us at indiegogo@quotemylab.com

story:
Long and the short of it...

Hi Everyone,
My name is Stephen Piccone, a Boston-based Poet and Writer. To my more-than-generous Social Media following, I'm known as Spwrites. As a child of the 80's Metal-Generation, I gained a love for poetry through my passion for music and songwriting. It always felt natural. And through events in my life, some good and bad, my ability for Poetry has come out with a force. 

Still with me? Good :)

I'm launching this campaign to help fund my first book, "The Book of Sorrowful Lies."  I feel it's important to everyone to have a great sense of self-accomplishment. I get true accomplishment when my words reach so many people around the world through Social Media, and the strangers I inspire. Now I want to join the ranks of 'published' Writers. Which is where you, the contributor comes in.

 

What I Need & What You Get...

Money! :) Even though there are many free services, which are fantastic, I'm choosing to go through a print house that specializes as the all-in-one deal, bookbaby.com. I will be asking for $3000.00 *(I honestly never knew how expensive it was to print a book. Especially Hardcover)  to fund the initial run which cover everything from the cover design, formatting, printing, editing, marketing and everything else I'm forgetting at the moment. Every book on the initial run will be an 'Author's Copy' and will be shipped by my personally since it's my intention to sign every one. Otherwise, everything beyond this campaign, the print house takes care of shipping. Which is good because my closet of an apartment doesn't have a lot of room.

I have alot of fantastic gifts to offer.

  • The Soft and Hardcovers all signed, and shipped by me.
  • 5x7 Print Cards, also signed.
  • Thank you shout by name in the final video to all donors.
  • Skype Call.  

And...for the higher-tier donors....

  • The original, handwritten pages for the construction of this book. These are true one-of-a-kind and not copies.They also have notes that have led to the creation of other works not in this book. My handwriting is unique and isn't learned by the children of today, sadly.        
  • *Note, I still retain all creative rights to all words on the original pages.                                                            

The Impact...

Books today seem to be fewer all the time. On a personal level, and even though this will be released in digital, I feel it's important for the tangible and physical to remain important. Nothing can ever replace the feel, or smell of an actual book. 
I never thought I would ever get to this point. And when I hit 5,000 followers, I started to think, "Can I really pull this off?"  When I hit almost 30,000 in a little over two-years, The answer was a resounding, 'absolutely.'
 

Risks & Rewards...

As this is going to be a fixed-funding, and the printing depends on this campaign succeeding, It's an all-or nothing deal. This is a gamble. But I'm confident in my fans and my Social Media presence.

Are you still here? Good :)

So if you've read this far, I hope you'll consider donating to my campaign. I don't intend to print any of these works in another volume. So every copy bought will be unique. Thank you so very much!

And if you can't, I love you just the same.
I would so appreciate it if you would share this across your social media's :) TELL YOUR FRIENDS! :)

"And what should happen if we exceed funding?" 

I'm glad you asked; ALL proceeds will be put towards my second book, and what I hope will be my first Novel. No, I won't spoil the surprise. It's a character who is my alter-ego and something I've been creating and refining in one facet or another for the last 30 years. I wouldn't be surprised if it was optioned for a screenplay. But first things first...

On with the show!

story:
My name is Rita Azevedo and I'm the creator of the Inner-City Prophet. I'm from a small town in Porto, Portugal and I've created this project under the the artist name of Rita Scamander back in September 2017.

The INNER-CITY PROPHET is a printed Zine focused on contemporary life & art issues. This Independent Magazine defends unpopular views expressed in the first person in an informal writing style. In between, one shares references of art, cinema, philosophy, literature, music & poetry. The most important thing is that these ideas can reach curious minds easily, even if they never came across that matter.

The first issue reached cities such as London, Paris, Dublin, Edinburgh, Porto, Lisbon & Alberta. Here's what I'm trying to archieve with this fundraise:

  • My dream would be to have the second issue launched in the beginning of 2019;

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need to make this happen:

  • We will need 2000 euros to cover the printing costs and also pay to writer & illustration contributors;
  • Depending on your generous contribution you will receive copies of the zine and official illustrated postcards!
  • IIf we can't reach the final goal the funds will still go to the printing costs but I will have to pay everything else from my pocket and sadly I won't be able to pay the writer/ illustration contributors. Please help me reward them for working with me on this exciting project!

The Impact

Why we need your help:

  • Your help will make artists feel rewarded and make their capacities and effort being appreciated;
  • You are supporting independent publishing and allowing small revolutionary ideias and views spread trough the world;
  • You are supporting the habit of reading and let the old fashioned paper have a place in modern society.

Risks & Challenges

There are challenges when it comes to getting more issues printed and it's always a risk when it comes to creative writing but we believe we can make it better and take the experience from the first issue to improve the second one. We are thinking of improving the cover design and if the budget allows, extending the number of pages from 32 to 36/42.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Follow us and share our instagram page with your friends @innercityprophet and help us get more views that way you'll be helping a lot without a pennie.
  • You will see on our instagram that the Inner-City Prophet project extended and now I also design stickers, postcards, snailmail goods etc in that page, check out if there is any stationery goods of your interest and visit our online shop: https://tictail.com/innercityprophet

Thank you so much for your time. Have a lovely new year!

story:
I wrote a comment in a UFO blog a few years ago asking if anyone had experience with rumbling in the water and transmissions on their radio connected with any UFO sightings (it was part of my Fathers experience).

Many months later I was emailed by a resident of the area. I told my Father and he was hesitant, but finally began a conversation with G. DeMarco. He connected my Dad to Linda Moulton Howe. My Father had two very long phone conversations with Linda. She aired his story on Coast to Coast AM.

After the interview he began to recall a lot more of his encounter. I found 2 huge boxes of his paintings and sketches in my garage. They were taped up and stored high on a shelf by my Father decades ago. Some of the art and sculptures have a bearing on his experience that will be noticed as I tell his full updated story.

I need to build a full blown web site with dozens of images he painted and sculpted. I work full time and can only devote part time to the project. I must hire out much of the web site work such as:  Reviewing and typing from my hundreds of pages of notes. Sizing and preparing his paintings and sketches to show on the site and offering copies for sale. It took me a month just to get this far. I fear I will not complete his full story by myself. All those that contribute funds will be offered discounts on copies of the limited editions of his art and a peek at how it is progressing.

My Father describes the incident, "It was very unusual to see clouds so close to the ground, so small in size and so well defined. They remained in front of me for sometime. The small dark oval clouds were about 400 feet away and appeared to be covering solid images. They were moving slowly up and down behind the trees. I estimated them to be about 20 feet in size and oval shaped."

"Something in the reservoir water to my right was making an audible rumbling sound and my car was vibrating. I looked and did not see anything in or near the water that was making the sound. I then turned my head straight ahead and was looking thru the windshield at the two small clouds that were slowly beginning to reveal what they were concealing. The continuous fast beeping transmissions on my car's am radio continued. After a few minutes something made a rustling sound in the woods to my left. I could feel the hair on my arm rise straight up. I felt a paralysis over my body. I originally thought out of intense fear that I did not turn my head to my left to look. My car was between that sound and the reservoir water where the rumbling noise was coming from. For many years my mind went blank when I tried to recall that moment up to the time I sped away. Recall began to slowly emerge over four decades later."

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Noemi created her first zine more than 18 years ago

Hi my name is Noemi and I'm a poet and creative from South Texas. My borderlands tongue story begins centuries ago in Puerto Rico and Mexico  and more recently, how my parents met in Chicago. 

My dad came to the US as a bracero and was used for his labor. My mom and her family were displaced from Puerto Rico when she was very young.  After living in Chicago we moved to South Texas where the idea of being split biculturally and triculturally was even more pronounced.

I came to zines when I was about 20 and wrote my first zine "Making of a Chicana." Influenced by young punk women of color at the time who were making zines, I wanted to document my experience as a young brown crip mother in a little place called the Rio Grande Valley as I dealt with being a single parent, poverty, working/working poor, chronically ill,  depression/anxiety and all the feelings in between. 

This zine anthology includes the work I have done since then, beginning with "Making of a Chicana"  in 2001, the first issue of hermana resist from 2002 as well as other one offs and mini zines I did. 

-Including in this anthology:

 Hermana, Resist 1-5

-Aged Noise

-Making of a Chicana

-Lines from Acedia to Apatheia

-The blue metal kettle

What's inside this 8x10" collection: 

200 + pages filled with zines I've written in the last two decades. 

The Funding

The funding of this project will go directly to pay printing costs and other associated fees for a first print run. It will also go towards promotional materials and shipping fees. 

Anything above this amount will go towards travel fees and tabling. 

The Impact

Documenting our existence and history is vital and so many queer crip women and nonbinary zinesters and writers work is lost because it is not archived. 

The reality is that many presses don't want to take on a zine anthology project because of the cost and size. Many also believe that since zines are a dying lo-fi product, zine anthologies won't sell and won't have traction. Another reality is that collections by women of color and nonbinary zinesters of color just do not get produced. Documenting the existence of our work from decades past is vital to portraying a part of history that we were part of, and a testament that this medium of communication was important for us latinx, grrls, punks, and others trying to find our voice, and each other. 

 

Many zines of decades ago vanish without being preserved. The flats are lost or their makers are no longer with us. I strongly believe, and have advocated for ever, that it's necessary to preserve our work both because it's culturally significant and because we are often missing from zine history and history itself. Writing and producing zines is one way of documenting our existence and writing our own history, but so is preserving these written histories. 

Challenges

There are challenges with this getting accepted at traditional indie presses. This is a large collection and comes in at about 200 pages, and after having shopped it around to different presses set a goal to get this printed and ready in 2018. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share my campaign with peer, friends and colleagues.

Get in touch with me if your institution can host a reading, zine fair, zine presentation and  host me!

The perks

I've created some cool perks including t-shirts and cool zines I'm working on for this coming winter, including a pandemic coloring book & zine inspired by 80s new wave & synth music.

The back of the Hermana, Resist T-shirt: 

 

cover sample. This is Amanda Ismailler, commissioned work. <3

To leave me a tip: https://ko-fi.com/hermanxresist

 

Your donations and contributions mean the world to me. Your continued support for all my projects truly make me feel valued :)

 

Questions & About Me

If you have any questions about the book, feel free to email me at hermanaresistpress@gmail.com

Hope you will donate to the campaign!

Noemi Martinez is a queer crip femme poet-curanderx, mixed media artist and writer with magical roots from Mexico and Puerto Rico. A single mami of 2, she lives in a multi-crip fam in deep South Texas. She created a small micropress Hermanx Resist Press in 2014 and edits the online space Poems & Numbers which produces #nof!ckingborderwall, a litmag. 

Some of her poems, essays and art can be found in Rest for Resistance, Bitch, TAYO Literary Magazine, Jellyfish Review, Alyss Lit Mag, The Deaf Poets Society, Hip Mama Zine, The Perch, Rigourous, Make/Shift and Motherhood: Love on the Front Lines. She spills secrets and poems, late night twitter style @hermanaresist.
story_txt:
Noemi created her first zine more than 18 years ago
Hi my name is Noemi and I'm a poet and creative from South Texas. My borderlands tongue story begins centuries ago in Puerto Rico and Mexico  and more recently, how my parents met in Chicago. 
My dad came to the US as a bracero and was used for his labor. My mom and her family were displaced from Puerto Rico when she was very young.  After living in Chicago we moved to South Texas where the idea of being split biculturally and triculturally was even more pronounced.
I came to zines when I was about 20 and wrote my first zine "Making of a Chicana." Influenced by young punk women of color at the time who were making zines, I wanted to document my experience as a young brown crip mother in a little place called the Rio Grande Valley as I dealt with being a single parent, poverty, working/working poor, chronically ill,  depression/anxiety and all the feelings in between. 
This zine anthology includes the work I have done since then, beginning with "Making of a Chicana"  in 2001, the first issue of hermana resist from 2002 as well as other one offs and mini zines I did. 
-Including in this anthology:
 Hermana, Resist 1-5
-Aged Noise
-Making of a Chicana
-Lines from Acedia to Apatheia
-The blue metal kettle
What's inside this 8x10" collection: 
200 + pages filled with zines I've written in the last two decades. 

The Funding
The funding of this project will go directly to pay printing costs and other associated fees for a first print run. It will also go towards promotional materials and shipping fees. 
Anything above this amount will go towards travel fees and tabling. 
The Impact
Documenting our existence and history is vital and so many queer crip women and nonbinary zinesters and writers work is lost because it is not archived. 
The reality is that many presses don't want to take on a zine anthology project because of the cost and size. Many also believe that since zines are a dying lo-fi product, zine anthologies won't sell and won't have traction. Another reality is that collections by women of color and nonbinary zinesters of color just do not get produced. Documenting the existence of our work from decades past is vital to portraying a part of history that we were part of, and a testament that this medium of communication was important for us latinx, grrls, punks, and others trying to find our voice, and each other. 
 
Many zines of decades ago vanish without being preserved. The flats are lost or their makers are no longer with us. I strongly believe, and have advocated for ever, that it's necessary to preserve our work both because it's culturally significant and because we are often missing from zine history and history itself. Writing and producing zines is one way of documenting our existence and writing our own history, but so is preserving these written histories. 
Challenges
There are challenges with this getting accepted at traditional indie presses. This is a large collection and comes in at about 200 pages, and after having shopped it around to different presses set a goal to get this printed and ready in 2018. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Share my campaign with peer, friends and colleagues.
Get in touch with me if your institution can host a reading, zine fair, zine presentation and  host me!
The perks
I've created some cool perks including t-shirts and cool zines I'm working on for this coming winter, including a pandemic coloring book & zine inspired by 80s new wave & synth music.
The back of the Hermana, Resist T-shirt:

story:
Story

 

The Rainy Day Zoo is a colorful and vibrant story about a young Ghanaian-British child who uses the magic of his imagination to turn a sad and grey rainy day inside into a wonderful adventure of the Zoo trip he didn't get to go on.  

 

Full-color illustrations and exciting phrases on each page teach collective nouns and the Twi (pronounced Chwee) pronunciations of each animal; "Snap! A bask of crocodiles(o-den-chem)!"  "Over there...a prickle of porcupines(kor-tor-kor)! "

 

Twi is a tonal language spoken in Ghana, West Africa, where the author is from.  80% of Ghanaians speak Twi and there are estimated to be more than 18 million Twi speakers across the globe. You and your child can add another language to your belt!

 

Here are some sneak peeks of the illustrations!

 

 

Includes spreads with fun facts about Ghana and the animals for you to enjoy

 

Hear a sample of the audiobook!

 

The specs are:

  • 32-pages of story and fun facts about Ghana and the native animals in the book
  • Full-color illustrations
  • 216 L mm x 279 H / 8.5' L x 11' format
  • Premium coated silk gsm paper
  • Glossy Lamination Finish

 

 

I'm Kobina, a Ghanaian dad to two rambunctious boys (2 and 7 ) born and raised in the UK. My kids and I love reading, but I quickly found that there weren’t enough books or resources that represented our roots.

 

That's why I write – for young readers who have yet to see themselves represented in a children’s book, and for inquiring world explorers who are ready to discover new worlds and cultures!

 

My call to action came when my son began to ask questions about his identity. He was asking why he was different and, with nothing in the marketplace that represented him, I sprang into action and self-published my first children's book. There are no words to describe the look of excitement and amazement I saw in his eyes when he held the first book in his hands. It made all the late nights and hard work worth it.

 

I realized that day, that I want other Ghanaian children to have that same look in their eyes when they pick up a book. Every child deserves that at least once.

 

This book is one small step closer to adding more representation to the world of children’s literature.

 

 

ONLY 29% of all children's books feature main BIPOC characters. There are more books about animals than there are about ALL BIPOC combined!

 

Only 11.9% of children's books in 2019 had Black or African characters, according to We Need Diverse Books.

 

In today's multicultural and diverse world, we believe that is simply not good enough!

 

Promoting tolerance requires engaging with ideas, people and cultures that you might not be familiar with and picture books are a powerful way to do that.

With your support, we will be one step closer to creating an inclusive culture among the next generation.

 

You get to make a difference twice! Your support diversifies bookshelves across the globe AND allows us the funds to print an accessibly priced special edition for Ghanaian children!

 

 

 

Kobina is a Ghanaian father with a vivid imagination. This is his second self-published book. The first self-published title - Rambunctious Kwame is still selling well. Kobina also has a number of traditional children’s book contracts in development with major publishers. He understands self-publishing and has established contacts within the book industry.

 

Kobina has had a love of reading since he was a young boy and now his kids share that same love. His passion for writing was born out of a desire for his kids and others to have a connection to their home continent, see characters that look like them, and read about experiences they can connect with. It‛s also for other kids to experience how other cultures live, their food, and language, whilst showing that after all, we are all alike in our hopes, dreams, and aspirations.

 

Kobina is also a co-founder of two initiatives working to increase Black representation in publishing. The first is BlackCreatorsInKidLit, a ground-roots organization focused on improving the craft of Black creatives and providing opportunities and the second is Haberman+Nerds Press, a wholly African owned publisher focused on finding African creatives with potential and nurturing them to compete on the world stage.

 

When Kobina is not writing, he's working as a Software Engineering Manager at a financial company.

 

Find out more about Kobina here

 

 

As a child, she was obsessed with reading and would always choose books that invited her in with an exciting book jacket or beautiful illustrations.  Lisa has a vivid imagination and has, for as long as she can remember, used this to write her own stories and illustrate them. As soon as she was able, Lisa picked up a pencil and began to draw and she’s hardly put one down since. She would spend hours as a child creating artworks and was actually probably a pretty annoying kid as when asked what she wanted to do the answer would always be ‘colouring in’.

This love for visual storytelling carried right through Lisa’s education to Loughborough University where she studied for her degree in Illustration with animation. Since graduating she has become a published illustrator. Lisa has also been a children's teacher for 9 years.

Find out more about Lisa here

 

Risks & Challenges

There are currently no foreseeable risks involved in this project.  The funding goal has been met. We are awaiting funds from Kickstarter to begin printing.

 Due to COVID-19, we have accounted for any issues that may possibly arise including potential shipping delays. In the event that there are delays beyond the indicated timeline, we will continue to communicate any updates with you via the updates system.

Thank you so much for your time and support! To stay connected, please visit us on Twitter @bernardkmensah and on Instagram @bernardkmensahwrites.

story:
Sackcloth Angel: My Serial Novel and YOU!

FIRST DOWNLOAD THE FREEBIE PROLOGUE HERE. See I'm already giving you something for FREE!

Nearly three years ago, I shelved a novel that I had been writing for over a year. Birthed from one of my favorite topics (inevitability), it follows a rather unlikely character, with a rather bizarre mission. What is that mission, you ask? I'm not telling you...but you will certainly be able to read about him.

Rather than throw my book at the masses in one fell swoop, I'm going to follow one of my inspirations growing up: Stephen King. His The Green Mile series was released as a series of "pulpy" little serial paperbacks (all less than 100 pages each) in six installments. I loved it! I couldn't wait for the next book to come out (which, if memory serves, were spaced roughly a month apart).

Well, I'm going to take that a step further, and also make it much less expensive than the $6.99 or so that I slapped down every month to get Mr. King's fine serial. I think that by the time the sixth installment was released, I must have payed over $40 for the whole book.

I'm not so greedy :)

I am releasing my book, Sackcloth Angel in serial installments, roughly 15,000 words at a time. And all that you need to do is pony up $3. The most you will ever have to pay for the whole book (5 phases of 15,000 words) is $15.

What's the catch?

Ahh! Good question! Here are the rules!

  • I have posted the Prologue to Sackcloth Angel for download right here. Go read it. It's just under 2,000 words and should give you just a brief taste of what's to come.
  • If you like it (and why wouldn't you???), donate $3 to my campaign.
  • If you really like it (and, again, why wouldn't you???), tell your friends to come here, click the link, download the Prologue, and read it, enjoy it, and donate $3.
  • If and when the campaign reaches $1000, I will release the first 15,000 word installment to the masses.

So, wait. Once it is released, anybody can read it?

Yes, it does give a chance for the freeloaders of the world to wait until the campaign reaches $1000 and then they don't have to donate. But, we don't actually KNOW anybody who would do that, right?

What if I love it so much, I want to donate MORE than $3?

An excellent question, friend! If you decide that you would like to donate more, by all means, do so. Here are a few perks in addition to my wonderful writing. Since I am constantly editing and revising the draft, you have a chance to mold the story just a bit:

  • If you donate $10, one of the characters will be named after you (or in honor of someone whose name you provide).
  • If you donate $25, and you can suggest a situation (much like you would at a comedy improv club) that I will need to work into the story. Within reason, of course. Also, anyone who donates at this level will receive a signed copy of the finished work when all the phases are complete.
  • If you donate $100, you can name a character, suggest a situation, and you will get a very special, limited edition, hardcover version of the book, once released (limited to 5 per campaign).

So  that's it!

Download the story, read it, enjoy it, pony up $3, wait for it to hit $1,000 raised, then you get to enjoy the first installment...and, of course, wait for the next campaign to unlock the next installment!

Is there anything else?

Isn't there always? This is a work in progress. Before the entire book is released after all the "serial phases," it will go through at least one more phase of editing/proofing just to make sure there are no remaining rough edges.

story:
** // On the 'Comments' tab, tell us what Cover colour you'd like this book to be printed in (Grey, Pink or Yellow). The most voted Cover colour wins!//

From the lips of the creator, "Last weekend I spent 2 nights in the hospital with my little one as he battled a lung infection; I was graced to meet a teen who was on admission - this was her second failed attempt at excessive self-harm. She'd had a go at self-harm twice in two weeks and almost died in both cases. Her's is a story of acceptance, relevance and a lack of self-love. This encounter re-emphasised once again the reality of the world in which our teen girls find themselves - there is a constant daily and periodic battle in their minds; a fierce battle for acceptance, love, relevance, perfection and self-love! 

OWN IT! is timely in that there is a growing movement in the Western world and abroad for real, substantive content that helps empower young women. Readers crave information that speaks to their heart and the heart of our society. OWN IT! is a beautiful marriage of inspiring content, clever design, and witty insight. This 2-in-1 book explores the vast landscape of emotions that adolescent girls experience – from tragedy and despair to joy, elatement and self-love. Though it touches on the hardships and mental blocks that many young women face, it more importantly provides a heartfelt look at the other side, the light at the end of the tunnel. This approach was carefully chosen in order to help reduce the allure of loneliness, self-hate, suicide attempts, suicides and self-harm so many adolescent girls experience. 

The purpose of this book series is to help revolutionise young female identity and watch as it impacts the wider world; and to continue the trend of empowerment and strength that our girls are feeling. It is my sincere hope that this project will inspire more people to join in the effort to bring dignity and hope to the life of young women across the globe."

We want to publish our first 600 copies.

Accompanying each Early Bird Special copy of the book will be a beautifully illustrated and well crafted DIGITAL daily Resolution Planner.

We went out to teen girls across 11 ethnicities and we collected anonymous data on how they genuinely feel about themselves; we came away with more insight than we bargained for. Below you'll find some of the discoveries we came across;

 

 

..... And they also kindly shared their inner thoughts with us;

Understanding these statistics underscores the importance of this campaign. A great number of teenage girls feel awful about their bodies, image, character and more. What you see on the outside is a girl who 'seems happy and fulfilled', but many teenage girls tell us this is so - they do not love themselves! Guess what, this trend was same across the 11 ethnicities we surveyed. It is a global trend.

We want to help teen girls learn more about themselves, their mind, their actions and their daily responsibility. We believe that spelling this out in a book is more beneficial and will act as a reference point for them. By contributing to this campaign you will help make this happen for no fewer than 600 teenage girls.

 

This is specifically made for girls age 12-19 years.

Only Teenage girls?

No. Specifically for teen girls, but suitable for pre-teens and young adults.

 

Two books have been combined to create OWN IT! One half is a book of success and empowering explanatory quotes, the second half is a book of mental and emotional challenges, including ideas and a workbook that'll help the young female intentionally  access where she is at presently, where she'd love to be in the near future and how to get there. More importantly, because too many words spoil the pie or get avoided by teenagers, we decided to 'SPEAK UP' in multidimensional life quotes for girls and to girls who feel powerless, un-loved and ridden with the guilt of their past - we want to make them understand that every stage in life is but a stage and they can absolutely OWN each stage. 

All quotes are original and from the heart strings of the Bold Girl laboratory (not a real lab, more like a think-tank space:)

OWN IT! has 60+ multidimensional and explanatory life quotes, emotional and mental scenario challenges plus ideas, and a workbook designed to inform, empower, and motivate girls to take action and OWN their everyday journey in life. Some of the topics covered are;

... including topics on Your Body, Legacy, Foresight, People skills and lots more.

 

 

The money raised from this campaign will enable us to finish and deliver this beautifully illustrated hardcover book to at least 600 girls around the world. The initial funding goal of £8,500 (US$11,800) will help to fund: 

within the timescales below;

Before we send the book to print, we plan to invite teen group subject matter experts, and a few on the ground experts to review the book's content, to ensure fairness and precision of impact. We also are considering using one of the best printing companies in the world (in North America) to produce our book.

Early Bird Specials come with a free downloadable digital OWN IT! Resolution Planner;

Digital Resolution Planner

Also, as part of the Early Bird Special, we will pay a fraction of the delivery cost - saving you more money!

 

Hello! We are Nkechie Ilori, BJ Lawal and Sylvia. Nkechie is the creator of OWN IT!, an author to a published book, and the founder of A Bold Girl Movement; a movement built simply to help teen girls build inner resilience, boldness and focus.  We are people working to impact the world positively.  

Sylvia comes from a world of content development and management; a former high school teacher and a marketing whiz who has worked with a few FTSE 50 companies. BJ's experience is in strategy and business analysis; he works with teenagers in a non-profit capacity and has done so for over 10 years. 

Combining our strengths together is our little way  of contributing to a greater and better society and world. 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a low risk project.

While the book is 75% finished, we have worked hard to structure the book's content management; we are collaborating closely with our illustrators, and the full delivery of all illustrations will be complete by the second week in January 2018. We will invite subject matter experts to review the content to make sure that the content and the precision of impact is as should be.

We will do everything we can to meet the timeline. In case of any problems and delays, we will make sure to inform you as soon as they arise.

 

Ways You Can Help Spread the Word

Please would you share this campaign and lets get to as many teachers, parents, relatives and friends?

Share using this link: Share

This 2-in-1 book explores the vast landscape of emotions that adolescent girls experience – from tragedy and despair to joy, elatement and self-love. Though it touches on the hardships and mental blocks that many young women face, it more importantly provides a heartfelt look at the other side, the light at the end of the tunnel. This approach was carefully chosen in order to help reduce the allure of loneliness, self-hate, suicide attempts, suicides and self-harm so many adolescent girls experience. 
The purpose of this book series is to help revolutionise young female identity and watch as it impacts the wider world; and to continue the trend of empowerment and strength that our girls are feeling. It is my sincere hope that this project will inspire more people to join in the effort to bring dignity and hope to the life of young women across the globe."
We want to publish our first 600 copies.
Accompanying each Early Bird Special copy of the book will be a beautifully illustrated and well crafted DIGITAL daily Resolution Planner.

We went out to teen girls across 11 ethnicities and we collected anonymous data on how they genuinely feel about themselves; we came away with more insight than we bargained for. Below you'll find some of the discoveries we came across;
 

 
..... And they also kindly shared their inner thoughts with us;


Understanding these statistics underscores the importance of this campaign. A great number of teenage girls feel awful about their bodies, image, character and more. What you see on the outside is a girl who 'seems happy and fulfilled', but many teenage girls tell us this is so - they do not love themselves! Guess what, this trend was same across the 11 ethnicities we surveyed. It is a global trend.
We want to help teen girls learn more about themselves, their mind, their actions and their daily responsibility. We believe that spelling this out in a book is more beneficial and will act as a reference point for them. By contributing to this campaign you will help make this happen for no fewer than 600 teenage girls.

 

This is specifically made for girls age 12-19 years.
Only Teenage girls?
No. Specifically for teen girls, but suitable for pre-teens and young adults.
 

Two books have been combined to create OWN IT! One half is a book of success and empowering explanatory quotes, the second half is a book of mental and emotional challenges, including ideas and a workbook that'll help the young female intentionally  access where she is at presently, where she'd love to be in the near future and how to get there. More importantly, because too many words spoil the pie or get avoided by teenagers, we decided to 'SPEAK UP' in multidimensional life quotes for girls and to girls who feel powerless, un-loved and ridden with the guilt of their past - we want to make them understand that every stage in life is but a stage and they can absolutely OWN each stage. 
All quotes are original and from the heart strings of the Bold Girl laboratory (not a real lab, more like a think-tank space:)

OWN IT! has 60+ multidimensional and explanatory life quotes, emotional and mental scenario challenges plus ideas, and a workbook designed to inform, empower, and motivate girls to take action and OWN their everyday journey in life. Some of the topics covered are;



... including topics on Your Body, Legacy, Foresight, People skills and lots more.


 
 

The money raised from this campaign will enable us to finish and deliver this beautifully illustrated hardcover book to at least 600 girls around the world. The initial funding goal of £8,500 (US$11,800) will help to fund: 

within the timescales below;

Before we send the book to print, we plan to invite teen group subject matter experts, and a few on the ground experts to review the book's content, to ensure fairness and precision of impact. We also are considering using one of the best printing companies in the world (in North America) to produce our book.

Early Bird Specials come with a free downloadable digital OWN IT! Resolution Planner;


Digital Resolution Planner
Also, as part of the Early Bird Special, we will pay a fraction of the delivery cost - saving you more money!
 


Hello! We are Nkechie Ilori, BJ Lawal and Sylvia. Nkechie is the creator of OWN IT!, an author to a published book, and the founder of A Bold Girl Movement; a movement built simply to help teen girls build inner resilience, boldness and focus.  We are people working to impact the world positively.  
Sylvia comes from a world of content development and management; a former high school teacher and a marketing whiz who has worked with a few FTSE 50 companies. BJ's experience is in strategy and business analysis; he works with teenagers in a non-profit capacity and has done so for over 10 years. 
Combining our strengths together is our little way  of contributing to a greater and better society and world. 
 
Risks & Challenges
This is a low risk project.
While the book is 75% finished, we have worked hard to structure the book's content management; we are collaborating closely with our illustrators, and the full delivery of all illustrations will be complete by the second week in January 2018. We will invite subject matter experts to review the content to make sure that the content and the precision of impact is as should be.
We will do everything we can to meet the timeline. In case of any problems and delays, we will make sure to inform you as soon as they arise.

 
Ways You Can Help Spread the Word
Please would you share this campaign and lets get to as many teachers, parents, relatives and friends?
Share using this link: Share

story:
THE STORY

Psych City is not what it seems.

Corporations run the city, controlling its citizens through subliminal messages and colour manipulation.

but only a few people are immune to it.

Jay believes that everything is normal as he lives his life. But it isn't until he meets a stranger that he is shown the true side of the city that not only changes his life, but everyone within the city.

When Jay is introduced to people who share his spirit they can help and guide him through his new found knowledge, but the only knowledge they are missing is How and Why as they continue their pursuit for the truth. 

With the Insights now carrying another pursuer, their questions are almost answered but their investigation only leads them with more work to do.

Only until the truth is finally revealed do they discover that they are actually protecting them. But that's far from the beginning!

The truth is dangerous, but is far from what they expected. 

 

JAMIE HASWELL 

It has taken a whole two years to complete this novel, in which the time has allowed me to prepare for over 200 more ideas, prepared to place on paper and release into the world so you can read it. 

My passion is to write but my passion is also to provide people with not just a story, but a dimension, a change. 

Books in our modern world have tended to follow a strict and narrow line which only includes a story and in my honest opinion, i have found that they tend to be repetitive where every book i read is exactly the same as the next book on the shelf. 

This upsets me! 

I love to write about new things -MY IMAGINATION- I love to create new worlds, exciting worlds, new creatures. I like to write about the IMPOSSIBLE!

A book is not supposed to be something logical. Unless you're reading the dictionary then a book is supposed to be fun, gripping and should not end when you finish it, but ask you to create and wonder!

"A writer only begins a book. A reader finishes it" 

- Samuel Johnson

 

WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT?

For the two years in which i wrote, i could not help but think about people reading my book.

Whether I was on my daily commute, i would watch the people who sat on the train, immersed in their pages, the slight mimic their lips made as they read the words their characters spoke within their books as if they were the character themselves. 

To see someone reading Psych City on the train. To see someone move their lips as they sat with their eyes locked onto the page, speaking as the character. To see someones life shift, from commuting to work at 7am in the morning, not knowing if they would get home in time to see the sun. Not knowing if they would get to see their children before they hurried into bed that night. To see their life propel into Psych City, to live with Jay as he searched, to explore the colour littered city as the reader alternated into the dimension of Psych City. This would make the 2 years of my life that i poured passion onto pages a dream. 

To me YOU are important. I want to make you smile. I want you to be immersed by Psych City!  

A book is a window into another world.

Image credit to: John-Mark Smith (@mrrrk_smith)

 

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION 

The aim of this campaign is to raise the word of Psych City.

My passion is writing and my passion is for You and everyone else who wants to or has the opportunity to read Psych City. 

You will help me achieve one of my greatest dreams and one of my greatest goals.

I began writing stories from the age of 9. Obviously, they were the ramblings and values of a child as most of them were of either me or another child playing with their friends and eating sweets, nowhere near bestsellers!

From the age of 9, society around me and many others have crushed the dreams of people.

Dreams began to feel a long way away and like they were never reachable but I know dreams are reachable and from the age of 9 i have wanted nothing more but to show the world that you can reach your dreams, you can accomplish your goal as long as you act on it and do it. 

To be able to look at all the 9 year old's or anyone for that matter and be able to tell them that they could accomplish any thing they want to, will be the biggest accomplishment of my life. 

This is what you will be contributing to. 

You will be contributing to the rebuilding of childhood dreams and achievement. You will be able to look at yourself and tell yourself that you can do what you. You can look at your children and tell them that they can be whatever they want to be. 

Dreams are not made to be broken. Dreams are made to be lived.

 

WHAT WE NEED

The campaign minimum requirement is £500 / USD / CAD / EURO

In all honesty, Every little helps.

Any money we receive will go directly to the book, There will be no form of profit from contributions!

Fees that include 'going directly to the book' include:

  • Editing
  • Advertisement
  • Extra promotional items, including Hard back copies and Audio book formats.

Writing a book is the cheap part, it costs almost nothing to write. However, when publishing, expenses are incredible. 

Editing is to make sure the book is properly written, including spelling, grammar, punctuation and that sentences and even full paragraphs make sense and are easy to follow. This form is expensive as it is a purchasable service for physical time out of a persons day.

Advertisement is also an expense as this is the main form of promotion  that Psych City will receive. My aim is to provide readers with a book that will impress them and spike joy within their lives. Even if only a small percentage of people can read it will still bring joy to me. 

Extra promotional items will be a grand addition to Psych City as the more formats, the more enjoyable the content! This will provide so many more people with the opportunity to acquire Psych City! Whether on the road, an audio book will provide a way so that you can listen to Psych City on the go!

Finally, as an author, my ambition and my passion does not stop, not at one book!

My aim will continue, even if every person on the planet had a copy of PSYCH CITY, that would not stop me from writing. One book will never be enough, which is why i will contribute towards another book. a message is impossible to spread unless repeated. 

Funding, no matter the total outcome will be divided accordingly:

 

 

WHAT IF OVER THE MINIMUM IS REACHED?

Any contribution amount will go towards the book. 

Vary on the total may be accounted for due to editing only being required either once or twice, in which case any excess will be divided from the percentage of editing (as shown) into the total of the remaining three percentages.

A little bit further

Editing is an extremely expensive process.

The minimum authors must pay to have a book reviewed, read and edited for each individual service is over £200. Meaning all three would be £600.

As an individualistic person, i prefer to edit myself and with the help of friends. If the target for the campaign was to be reached the extended funds would go directly to the book, mostly because there would be either little funding left or none at all. There is nothing but passion to push Psych City!

 

WHAT YOU GET!

There is a range of perks that YOU, YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY AND EVEN CO WORKERS can receive!

The perks range from a contribution of £1 to £200 with even more in between for what ever you want!

Ebooks Of PSYCH CITY:

  • £1 - 1 Ebook!
  • £2 - 2 Ebooks!
  • £3 - 3 Ebooks!
  • £5 - 5 Ebooks!
  • £10 - 10 Ebooks!

Actual Paperback Book of PSYCH CITY:

  • £7 - 1 Book!
  • £14 - 2 Books!
  • £21 - 3 Books!
  • £35 - 5 Books!
  • £70 - 10 Books!

SPECIAL REWARDS

  • £100 - Acknowledgment in THE ACTUAL BOOK!

                 (Includes book)

  • £200 - SIGNED VERSION OF THE BOOK!

                 (Includes Book)

  • £250 ACKNOWLEDGMENT AND SIGNED VERSION OF THE BOOK! 

                 (Includes Book)

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There is no doubt that anyone and anything faces challenges in life. Even if you were a billionaire, mistakes are made, you could knock over a glass of £100 water that was sourced off of the moon whilst sitting on top of the Eiffel Tower as The Queen of England gives you a back rub, but if you knocked over that £100 water, onto the laptop that carries the only bank account connected to your billionaire business, then you have a problem!

Risks and challenges are designed to be overcome, whether you are a billionaire who has just lost connection to his fortune, you can simply go to the bank and recover it. 

There are risks and challenges in life, but no one has had to stop. 

Our challenges are as follows:

  • If there is no funding through this page, then it will financially be a struggle to popularise Psych City as the little money that I have to advertise with already, will have to stretch whilst keeping me alive.   
    • Self motivation: Within life many people have great ideas, if not all of us, and many things can put you down. Motivation and emotion are a very severe combination.  As an individual I do all of the work myself: Involving, writing, marketing, purchasing, research, strategies and more. All of this often causes stress and worry, but my ability to push is what keeps me going. The problem here, is that completing a book is a very long process and some days may not see as good of an outcome as i would have wanted. 

HOW TO OVERCOME OUR CHALLENGES

Challenges can sometimes be difficult to get through but they are not problems, no matter how many challenges are thrown at you, there will always be a way to complete what you are tasked to do. 

This is how we will overcome these challenges:

  • Money is not a rare source but publicity is. If no funding comes through then money will just have to be made! 
  • Motivation is key, and the key is to surround yourself with people that can motivate you, whether that is a team or just your family and friends, people are always there to help you. 

So far I have found it difficult to FIND ANY challenges! This is mostly due to the fact that i think about them before hand and i find a solution before it even becomes a problem and i plan and prepare in order to keep a clear method to prevent challenge. 

Indiegogo ASKS to share what qualifies me to overcome challenges. 

My reply is that i am only human. Together we make mistakes and together we fix those mistakes. 

Together we are human and together we are qualified to overcome any challenge that anyone or anything can throw at us.

How you can help without contributing!

Money is sometimes hard to come by or sometimes we have to struggle to just to feed ourselves, pay rent or support our families, whether with children or with unable parents.

I completely understand if you are unable to contribute in which case i would just like to THANK YOU! Thank you for reading my campaign, i have put a lot of effort into it and just your eyes reading it has made it worth while.

However, There is always room for some publicity!

In which case i would be ever grateful if you could share the word about the campaign and about Psych City when it is fully released!

Thank You Eternally For Reading and Supporting The Campaign and Supporting Me!

Thank You!

Jamie Haswell

Author of Psych City!

story:
369 game is a very popular game in Republic of Korea.
Practice and Enjoy.

* This book show how to play 369 game and answer which is famouse game in Republic of Korea.
* You don't need any tools, you need only mouth and hands.
* In Republic of Korea, People usually enjoy this game at a drink.
* You can get along with people who meet the first time easily.
* Really easy to enjoy all over the world.
* If you only know numbers, you can enjoy it regardless of language.

 

When the book '369 GAME ANSWER' is published, We will send to you first. It has under 250 pages in the book following the next.

* This book show how to play 369 game.
* You can learn from the video by QR code in the book.
* All the answer is ready from 1 to 9999.
* You can be confused but static answer is existed. so anybody can enjoy.
* We will down the price more than 50% and send to you first.

Game culture of Korea

There are games that use PC or mobile, but there are games that do not have any tools. There is a game that you can play anywhere, simply as a scissors rock.
* List of games not the 369 games are ready.
* List of know-how to get acquainted offline in addition to online.

 

Risks & Challenges

We already made all the contents of the book. Your funding will help printing. Others are following the next.
* You can get printed book.
* We will also send PDF files only for INDIEGOGO members.
